alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 10:40PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Outflow associated with strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, northwestern Brown and northwestern Keya Paha Counties through 1130 PM CDT/1030 PM MDT/... At 1038 PM CDT/938 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorm outflow ahead of a line of strong thunderstorms near a line extending from near Mission to 6 miles southeast of Kilgore to 9 miles south of Nenzel. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Valentine around 1100 PM CDT. Norden around 1130 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River, Crookston, Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area, Sparks, Smith Falls State Park and Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 158 and 217. Highway 97 between mile markers 121 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 195 and 222. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Western Cherry
